text: Hey <@UE70ED6JV>, good question. Right now, the border module style does target the container instead of the actual image. It’s an old, weird quirk of module styles that we’re working on fixing!
:wave: Hey <@UE70ED6JV>! Is this header module on a drag and drop page? If so could you send me a link so I can take a look and see what the issue is?
Hi <@UA7JFQSQ0> the module is on the drag and drop page . I'll send it shortly. Thanks
Ahh nevermind, I was able to reproduce this locally and I found the issue. I'll work on getting a fix out for this asap! :smile:
The issue should be resolved now, let me know if you run into anymore issues!

How can I pass a custom field through a blog loop? Here is my loop. I am wanting to pass a category value via custom field.
`{% set recent_posts = blog_recent_tag_posts('30549696659', '{{ module.category_slug }}', 20) %}`

`<div class="case-study-feed flex">`
  
`{% for recent_post in recent_posts %}`
`<div class="recent-box flexitem">`
  `<a href="{{ recent_post.absolute_url }}">`
    `<div class="recent-image" style="background-image:url('{{ recent_post.featured_image }}')">`
      `<div class="title-bg">`
            `<div class="recent-title">{{ recent_post.name }}</div>`
            `<div class="recent-title">{{ recent_post.widgets.case_study_location.body.html }}</div>`
      `</div>`
    `</div>`
  `</a>`
`</div>`
`{% endfor %}`

`</div>`
If you remove the quotes and curly braces you should be alright I believe.
